title: California Employment Agreement
description: Comprehensive employment agreement compliant with California labor laws. Includes at-will employment, compensation, benefits, and termination provisions.

content.html:
EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (the "Agreement") is made effective as of {{start_date}} (the "Effective Date") by and between:

Employer:
{{employer_name}}
{{employer_address}}

and

Employee:
{{employee_name}}
{{employee_address}}

1. POSITION AND DUTIES

Employee is hired as {{job_title}}. Employee shall perform all duties and responsibilities assigned by Employer, including those that may be assigned from time to time.

2. EMPLOYMENT AT-WILL

This Agreement constitutes at-will employment. Either Employee or Employer may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

3. COMPENSATION

Employer shall pay Employee an annual salary of ${{annual_salary}}, payable {{pay_frequency}}, subject to customary payroll deductions and withholdings.

4. WORK SCHEDULE

Employee's regular work schedule shall be {{work_schedule}}. Employee may be required to work additional hours as necessary to fulfill job responsibilities.

5. BENEFITS

Employee shall be eligible to participate in benefit programs as established by Employer, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off, subject to plan terms and eligibility requirements.

6. PROBATIONARY PERIOD

The first {{probation_period}} days of employment shall be considered a probationary period. During this time, Employer may terminate employment for any reason.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY

Employee shall maintain confidentiality of all proprietary and confidential information belonging to Employer, both during and after employment.

8. RETURN OF PROPERTY

Upon termination of employment, Employee shall return all property belonging to Employer, including documents, equipment, and access credentials.

9. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior discussions and understandings.

10. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California.

Employer
Employee
Date
